intro: Mammillaria pullihamata, commonly known as the Mexican Hedgehog Cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a dense covering of white, woolly spines. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–15 centimeters and features a ribbed stem with prominent areoles. It produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. This species is well-suited for rock gardens and requires well-draining soil and minimal water.
